review: Walking to grab some food before movie night and saw some friends sitting in the window like little puppy dogs.  Dropped in to say what's up.  "What's up?"  They asked if I would like to join them and sweeten the deal with a 20% off pizza coupon.  Who could say no to that? **Hands up, shoulders shrugged** Mango Tandori Pizza is on the sweet side with a little bit a heat and good flavors. BBQ Chicken was good and I recommend it. Chipotle.... Ok No complaints for a chain restaurant.

I would normally give this place 4 stars, but I decided to give it the full 5 due to the service. Our server was Tony and he was very cooperative and friendly. I think due to his kindness and great service that he made the environment more welcoming. We were coming in for our friend's birthday and he was a great server.  As for the food it was very tasty. The only wish I had about the place is that the portions were bigger. I did share between a lot of friends, but it be nice. Either way it was very tasty and Tony was a great server.  Recommend: the thai basel pasta (I believe that is what it is called) and the bbq smoked bacon pizza.

Blah.  The frozen Sicilian pizza is ok.  I've never tried the pizzas but have been here a bunch because: 1.  I'm broke and CPK accepts credit cards, or 2.  I'm craving carbs. The prices are SO NOT WORTH what you get!  I can't believe the portion sizes in the to go containers.  I ordered the ravioli once for $13, and I counted 5 raviolis.  Fuck that. Go to Little Henry's instead, on the corner of Larkin and Post.  Way way way better.

We took a co-worker there for lunch today for her birthday.  The Manager was so nice.  He took good care of us.  We got a free dessert and he gave her a card for a free pizza a drink next time she comes.   I shared the Moroccan chicken salad and a pepperoni thin crust pizza with a co-worker.  Both were very good.   Thanks for making my secretary's birthday special!

We have had great experiences here everytime we've been. Our first experience here, my husband and I and a group of friends went here after our first experience at the Ballet and it was open after the show.  The first time I had ever had a mojito, was here and the bartender made it REALLY good, because I still have had only a couple that held a candle to this one... We have been there a couple times since then, took my parents and my aunt to see West Side Story a year or so ago and had a really great dinner! I love their pasta's and salads and have never had a bad meal here.  The only strange aspect of this restaurant is going to the bathroom, it's down a kinda secluded scary hall...

I often fantasize that Gavin Newsom will slide into my booth here and enjoy a Sicilian with me.  A Sicilian PIZZA, that is.  The dish CPK does best.  I'd thank him for briefly legalizing gay marriage and praise him for marching with the hotel workers during their strike a few years ago.  I thought that was pretty cool.  We'd be playing footsie as I ordered a bottle of Chianti.  But then I'd let it slip that I think Matt Gonzalez would make far better mayor/boyfriend material and our lunch date would turn sour and he'd leave.  Date over, I'd be there with just my Sicilian pizza and glass of wine to keep me company.  And that'd be just fine. CPK's Sicilian pizza is bountiful with flavor, and the kind you can get at the supermarket does not do the restaurant version justice.  Vegetarians need not apply, as it's got Capicola ham, Italian sausage, and salami.  There's also three types of cheeses on it and a really sweet, crispy crust.  Other good pizzas include their Hawaiian pizza (ask for BBQ sauce instead of tomato) and the crowd favorite, Thai Chicken. Side note: Is it just me, or do the white palm tree silhouettes on the glass panels between booths look just like bird shit?  With, like, one long streak dripping down?  Oh my damn, I am so sorry for that mental image!  Because this place is pretty cool.  It is the most architecturally humble CPK I've ever been to.  Many others tend to have a grand semi-circular design that calls attention to the majesty of the kitchen, but this one is pretty unassuming and it hides in the shadows of City Hall.  Where the mayor works.

I stopped in CPK the other day, after who knows how long it's been since my last visit....and I loved it.  Yes, it was a HOT DAY, and YES their Air Conditioning is EXCEPTIONAL. But once we were immersed in that lavish A/C the rest all unfolded before us..... The server was super pro and very personable. When we orderd our drinks he immediately replied "I'll be keeping those full for you tonight". Japanese Eggplant Pizza. I'll admit it, on paper it sounds WACK. But I loved this Pizza.. So delicious and different. The  Southwest Pizza was also awesome. I love southwest anything.  Spring Roll's were really good too. CPK is what it is, but delicious food at a good price with good service never goes out of style.

There are several different types of pizza.  One is the "I want to eat a lot and stuff my face and be really full after a few slices."  Then, you have the "I want to be classy and eat flavorful thin-crust pizzas and never really be full after eating a whole pizza." CPK falls under the second category, but it's a good thing. I think the only pizza that I wasn't too fond of was the Thai Chicken, which happens to be my best friend's favorite.  I love the BBQ Chicken (especially with the honey wheat crust), the Carne Asada (which tasted like you were eating a taco), and the Neapolitan style pizzas, which are thin-crust. Their other items are also delicious:  The miso salad with shrimp and crab is my favorite, followed closely by the Spinach-Artichoke dip. Oh, and what's better than getting free refills on all types of lemonade and Italian sodas?  Winning the lottery, I suppose.

Let's call it "Old, New California Cuisine".  Face it, folks - the menu hasn't changed much over the last 10 years. But, boy, the same old thing never fails when you're craving it.  Without much exception, I always get the same thing.  Thai Spring Rolls and BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad.  They used to have some pretty bomb Potato Leek Soup, but it's been off the menu for years. The service is a little touch and go.  Sometimes I have great service, other times I wait for almost 10 minutes before my order is taken. I think CPK is headed in the direction of needing a new concept if they want to beef up their San Francisco presence.  But if it still works in LA, where the sun is shining and the lunch hour rush is abundant, they won't have too many problems.

My first CPK experience was at this location.  I fell in love with the simple Tomato-Basil Spaghettini and 80% of the time, that is what I get. No meat, just a beautiful red, garlicky sauce. The complimentary bread is great as a sauce-scooper.  Also love the Thai Crunch salad - obviously crunchy, two great dressings you can mix together to make a unique combination of flavors.  (The pizza... the pizza.. I'm not a fan of unfortunately. Maybe the Thai Chicken pizza but it's just because there's a peanut sauce in place of the tomato sauce. The melange of toppings on their pizzas, the creativity put into making them is awesome.... but tThe crust is doughy and really not to my liking. I've given the pizza many tries... but nothing satisfies me more than my regulars.) A peach iced tea to go along with any meal, and it's perfect.  This is a great, humble chain of restaurants. Food is simple, staff is great, prices reasonable - what more could you ask for?

CPK IS AWESOME :] I've been to this CPK a couple of times already. The atmosphere of this place is pretty cozy. The lighting and seating gives off a comfortable and warm feeling. The waiters and waitresses are really friendly and nice too. The food here is really yummy. Of course, you're most likely here for the pizza. So give The Works pizza a try. It's like any supreme pizza you've had, but CPK makes that "typical" pizza not so typical. CPK also has some very "different" pizzas, like Cheeseburger pizza or Thai Chicken. The food here are all reasonably priced. If you're going to pay some other pizza place $15+ for an okay pizza, you might as well come to CPK for something better.  Try these: [[ The Works Pizza ]] [[ Grilled Vegetable Salad ]] [[ Tiramisu ]]

Alright CPK, here's the deal: I LIKE you. Not love. But like. I buy your frozen pizzas at the market whenever I want to celebrate payday or something similar (pathetic? I think "sad" is more apprapo). You're a fairly standard go-to chain restaurant where I can generally find something I like. Your waiters and waitresses are the genial type of people that I'd probably be friends with out in the real world. HOWEVER, something needs to be done. Numero Uno: Your Van Ness location's bathroom is located at the end of a very long hallway. Getting raped is not on my to-do list, but it might as well be if I venture near that toilet again. Numero Dos: Mango mojitos should have mangos in them. Not mango-flavored rum. REAL mangos. Itty bitty pieces of them. I know I'm asking a lot from a chain, but c'mon. Numero Tres: Where the HELL is the pear gorgonzola pizza? What do you mean you got RID of it? Are you CRAZY? That was one of the best! But you still get three stars cause I like you. And your "new" cajun pizza was a serviceable substitute for the lack of pear gorgonzola.

Well, it's a chain, so we'll get that out of the way. The food was middling at best, I had the Mango Tandoori pizza on wheat, and it made me wish we had gone to Naan and Curry instead. For $13 per pizza, there just isn't a defined value. Or a decent experience. Another problem I had... $4.75 for a 12 ounce glass of pyramid... you can get the same thing from a place like Sparky's for $3.00 (or $1.50 on happy hour.) So, I've done it, I've tried CPK, and I can now go back to ignoring them.
Its too bad that everyone is rating this CPK 3 stars or below. The location is fine. The restaurant is clean. The food is always consistent.   BBQ chicken salad...mmmmm good.  Hold the cilantro

i'm never disappointed with the food here, or any of the locations, as the food tastes the same no matter which one you go to.  the service is always friendly and nice in a standard, corporate kinda way.   the reason i'm writing this review is maybe slightly petty.  so, we were here for a friend's birthday.  we told the waiter, and he asked birthday boy if he wanted anything for dessert.  he said no, thanks, cuz he was full.  the waiter decided to be "nice" and bring out a small ice cream sundae anyway, even though my friend said no.  we all thought this was a sweet gesture.  THEN we realized we got charged for this extra dessert, even though no one asked for it.  to clarify, when we told the waiter it was our friend's birthday, it wasn't in a secret, please bring something surprising out for dessert with a candle on it and everyone sing kind of way.  the waiter asked specifically if we were celebrating anything, and we said, yes, our friend's birthday. i just thought it was tacky and rude to ask the birthday boy if he wanted anything, bring us something anyway, then charge us for it. to be nice, the manager must have over heard me complaining to my friends, so he took it off the bill.

this place isn't bad.  I usually get the pizza, no surprise!, but I heard their salads are pretty good as well.   good if you're wandering around and trying to hide from a panhandler. bad if you're in a big group around lunchtime.   service is okay, not too bad or too great.

What happened to CPK? I remembering CPK as one of my favorite restaurants in San Diego. Upon re-visiting an old favorite but here in SF, I was mildly disappointed at the food, portions, and especially the prices! In an attempt to not age myself, I'll just say that a few years back, I remember when half salads were $5 and pizzas were $10. Not only are they closer to $13 but they're noticeably SMALLER! Half salads are now approaching almost $10 too. What a rip-off! It was nice to see my old favorites still on the menu: bbq chicken, hoisin duck, and the assortment of mixed salads. We started off the chicken tortilla soup. This was really tasty! It had big chunks of chicken and the soup was hearty with a little bit of kick. We decided to try out one of the special pizza - some jambalaya pizza. It was good but nothing short of a combination pizza. I think I'll take my money and go to Extreme Pizza.
Where is Wolfgang Puck or Bobby Flay when you need them. This is not the best pizza.

Entascia Pinot Grigio - not so good.  Drink the Clos Du Bois Chardonnay--that's my tried and true. Spinach Dip - sizzling hot and not too greasy, chips were a bit stale.  Not enough dip to finish the chips, what a waste of food. Cobb Salad - with beets.  I don't eat beets, but DAMN, this salad was friggin DELICIOUS. TriColore Pizza with Salmon - Crust was not crunchy, it was chewy and I couldn't even cut up the slices.  Topping were delicious though.  It was like a bed of salad and salmon on top of flat bread.  No cheese....low fat, yo! Apple Pie ala Mode - Crust was fab, apples were a bit tart. Overall, I COULD eat here again, but why should I when I can have better pizza at Palamino or Park Chalet....or even Round Table.

Oh, how I love CPK!  I live in a culinary Mecca, yet I find myself regularly drawn to CPK for the BBQ Chopped Chicken Salad.  I cannot get enough of this stuff.  Order it with no cheese (yuck on the mushy grated soft processed cheese), light on the BBQ sauce, and I am in salad heaven.  The combination of basil, jicama, tortilla chips, ranch and just a leeeetle bit of BBQ sauce on romaine and headleaf lettuce with chicken is a delight.  Yes, a delight.   Minus one star because it's always SO cold in there!  Turn down the air con!  Everybody's got their jackets on inside and they're walking around in tank tops outside - does the Manager never notice that?   The flavored iced teas (mango/peach/strawberry/raspberry) are yummy but too sweet for me.  Service is usually pretty good.

Like CPK. Don't understand why people here have such issues about it being a chain. Oh..yes...it's hip to say that. I'm not a fan of this location.  I think the 3rd and Market location is better overall, especially with the hosts, servers and food prep. And they have a parking garage. Dan Shelton Don't Call It Frisco blog
Had the 4 cheese Ravioli with sauteed mushroos.  Awsome!!  Prices are average.

Why slam a place when it is as advertised ?  CPK is a chain restaurant and it's food, service and atmosphere is as expected for a chain restaurant.   Food : Same menu prepared directly out of the box with the finely printed instructions of dice, heat, plate, and serve.   Service : Same servers trying to understand true restaurant service but doesn't yet know how to re-fill soda with the proper amount of ice.  Atmosphere : Opera/symphony goers, lost tourists, blue collar Dad trying so hard to show the kids what fine dining is all about. We love this location of CPK and are there anytime we have tickets to anything at Civic Center. And to those who complain about the service, try smiling and being friendly to the staff and recognize that they are probably working their way up the food-service food chain.  Give'em a break ! Dinner Friday night was lettuce wrap appetizer, bbq chicken pizza, tequila fettuccine, 2 fountain drinks.  Food tab, plus tax was $41.  Service was excellent and we did make a comment to the manager who took a moment to thank the server himself.

Seriously good, consistant pizza, seriously consistantly terrible service.  I have been to the two CPK locations almost a dozen times now, and all but one time the service was lousy.   One would think you wouldn't have to ask for water, bread, AND silverware on Multiple occasions. Great food for anyone, as long as you don't mind the service.

It is odd to me that I've purchased their frozen pizzas in supermarkets, but have yet to actually order pizza while in the restaurant! When I worked in L.A., we used to order lunch in from CPK once per week, so I've tried most everything they offer (sans pizza), and am a big fan of two of the pasta dishes -- Thai Linguine and Jambalaya. The food is consistent, but they only get three stars from me for slowish table service and an overpriced menu, but they do sort of make up for all that with their yummy Key Lime Pie.

why did our waiter give us the thai crunch salad and not the chinese chicken salad? well since they are pretty similar it was too late to bring it back. (we didn't notice until we were crunching on the peanuts and the edamame beans.) our server thought he'd do "the not writing down your order thang" and he f*ckd up our order.. he actually screwd up the table next to us to. and another thing.. why don't they bus their tables.. man.. there were plates all over tables next to us.. quite unsightly..

The menu features appetizers and pasta from around the globe, ranging from Tuscan hummus and Singapore shrimp to Louisiana jambalaya and Thai linguine. Despite its name, I've never come here for the pizza, possibly because I'm too much of an Italian New Yorker to appreciate combinations of caramelized pear and gorgonzola or roasted duck breast and soy-glazed Shiitake mushrooms on a pie. My favorites (and the only items I've ever ordered) are the salads - the White Balsamic Provencal, a bed of crisp greens, arugula, and red cabbage topped with feta cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, Mediterranean olives, Roma tomatoes, and slices of grilled rosemary chicken breast; the Original Chopped, a combination of lettuce, basil, salami, roast turkey breast, diced tomatoes, cheese, scallions, and garbanzos tossed in an herb-mustard Parmesan vinaigrette topped; and the CPK Club, chopped lettuce with applewood smoked bacon, fresh avocado, grilled chicken, diced tomatoes, basil, fresh beets, and Gorgonzola with a thick and chunky blue cheese dressing. A half order is perfect for lunch, a full for dinner, although I've been known to take half home for a midnight snack.

I love love love CPK...Their pastas, salads and pizzas are delicious. Ive been going to CPK for a while now and I am never disappointed with their service. I recommend their garlic Alfredo pasta or their Caesar salad which is one of my favorites. I especially like this location because they offer curb side assistance. So I don't have to get out of my car =D

Spending time at a California Pizza Kitchen is like going to a really bad wedding reception where you meet the happy couple's extended family:  There's the overdressed but under-tasteful aunt (the salads);  the oily, garlicky, stale-smelling uncle (the pizzas); the dowdy, vaguely desperate sister (the atmosphere); and the sullen, annoying teenage cousins who have their own agenda and are mainly there to drink and smoke and make nasty remarks about the guests (the staff).  Just like the wedding reception, you are better off eating before you go.

Their Waldorf salad is amazing!!! It has apples and walnuts and grapes.. so delicious.  Ask for light dressing b/c the salad at the bottom tends to be soggy with all the dressing.  Pizza is okay but maybe b/c I like my pizza stuffed with cheese and this place has only moderate cheese.  Their sandwiches are light, but still tasty.  They are not very consistent though, but their staff is friendly enough that they will re-make it if you want.  I think their appetizers are a rip though b/c none of them actually should taste the way they do.  Save your money and go to the restaurants that normally serves these food.

We had a half order of Chinese chicken salad which was ok.  There was nice crunchiness, but the dressing was not authentic enough for me.   We also had the wild mushroom pizza which was good.   We had a strawberry banana smoothie and a soda for a total of $36. It is pretty convenient if you are going to see the performing arts in the area.
Worst stomach ache of life.  That about sums it up.

Update - Since I wrote this review, I contacted CPK's customer center, and very swiftly got a reply from the general manager, who has said he's going to do a quality control review with the staff, and share the details of our experience with them. I think this is a pretty great response.  Hopefully I can update my review with more stars - maybe CPK will rock again!! ****************************** Whooboy, what a disappointment. I'm old enough to remember when the original CA Pizza Kitchen opened up in Hollywood.  Didn't eat there 'til much later, but wow - bbq chicken pizza - yum! And I've eaten at more than one L. A.-based CPK, and had great California pizza experiences - excellent quality, fresh, plentiful and adventurous ingredients. I raved about CPK to my boyfriend, who's from Central Cali, is a pizza lover, and had never been to a CPK before.  He wanted to go here for his birthday, so that's what we did tonight. In a word - mediocre.  In another word - overpriced.  Should have known - the place was only half full on a Saturday night. To be fair, the salad (baby greens) was delicious - but the place isn't called California Salad Kitchen.  We ordered a BBQ Chicken Pizza (around $12) and a Goat Cheese and Grilled Veggie Pizza (around $13 with bacon added). (I want to emphasize - these are *personal sized* pizzas - mini pizzas.  For around $12 apiece.) They tried to bring us the pizza before we'd even got halfway through the salad - boooo. When it arrived, it was *such* a letdown. I make better pizzas at home.  Tasteless crust with no personality whatsoever; extremely stingy on the toppings.  I paid over $2 extra for some bacon on one of the pizzas; I think there was about six to eight little crumbs distributed over the entire thing, and poorly distributed at that.  We fed ourselves, eschewed dessert, and got the hell outta there - bopped down to Trader Joe's to get some chocolate, and saw pizzas in TJ's frozen food section that looked better than the ones we ordered for about $4.00 apiece. (Actually, the BBQ chicken pizza was about $2.75.) If the service or atmosphere had been spectacular, if the wine had been better, if they had done *anything* to acknowledge my boyfriend's birthday (I told the greeter when I came in; not a damn thing happened, not even a "happy birthday"), there might have been something to warrant the $50 plus price tag for a couple of drinks, two personal size pizzas and a shared salad - but no.  Shoulda read the reviews before we went.  What a huge disappointment. Boo, hiss.

I love California Pizza Kitchen. This location is great, and the wait isn't usually that long in the evenings (unless there is an event at the opera house or something), so you usually get seated pretty quickly. They are definitely kid friendly, well I mean they have high chairs. The staff can be nice, and the menu is great. I don't really like anything from their appetizer menu, and I always order their Hawaiian pizza, which seems to get more and more delicious every time I have it. I've tried their frozen pizzas from the supermarket, and it's just not the same as eating there and having it fresh. It's been a while since I've been, but hope to go back soon.

Now I'm not one to frequent chain restaurants, but I must say that CPK is a pretty good default to fall back on when you're running out of ideas. The menu is huge so you could spend hours deciding, which I guess is both a plus and a minus. This particular CPK is conveniently located close to the Opera/Ballet if you don't feel like shelling out more on a meal than on your tickets. It's nice and clean and the service is great. One of the waiters (Beau from Saratoga?) even ran two blocks to give me the leftovers of the awesome grilled rosemary chicken sandwich on herb foccacia that I absentmindedly forgot to bring with me. Now that's what I call service. I hope they give Beau a raise!

I think this CPK is just fine! Not sure why this one has such a low rating...perhaps the neighborhood? We've been here several times and they're very consistent. The mixed vegetable salad, the tostada pizza and pastas are great. The only things to complain about from my experience are: -The extremely long trip to the bathroom  -The manager (?) who roams around a little too closely. You know the one...with the bad hair.

I am totally up for ridicule, but I have a big, dirty love for CPK. I do not prefer the pizza (likened to cardboard by others, I can see it), but for some reason, the combo of the tortilla soup (blended. that's weird sort of, but weird good) and the gorgonzola chopped sald thingie with fried onion pieces on top floats the hell out of my boat. I rarely get here though, because I hate the location.  It's my comfort food.

As designer chain restaurants go, this one is pretty decent.  It's not a bad choice for pre-theater dining and I agree that the barbeque chicken pizza is quite good.  (Didn't these guys bring that combo into the mainstream pizza world? You have to give them some credit based on that brilliant introduction alone.)

I went to eat there with my friend tonight and we ordered the California club pizza and it as good.  I like the pizza here cuz its not too greasy compared to other pizza joints.  The pizza was flavorful and the service was good.

You know what makes this place so bomb?  It's their crusts.  I'm usually a deep dish girl, but their crust are thiney , yet still fluffy and delicious!  Thier tortilla soup is also amazing, although some think it's more tomtato soupy than they like.  Oooh, and get the spinach artichoke dip, it's yummmmmmy!  They have a bunch of vegetarian options and you can edit the toppings so you have exactly what you want.  I highly reccommend the Grilled Vegetarian sammie.  It's HUGE and mushroomey!  The only thing that sucks about this location is the parking is sometimes a bitch, and I hate searching for parking.

Two words... Lettuce Wraps  A must try when going to pizza kitchen, I've had some misses but for the most part my food is always good and if I have problems with my order the staff is always accommodating. Red Velvet cake and vanilla ice cream.. ooh lala!! Give me more!

Superbowl hurray. Go to someones house and they have ordered CPK...I have had it before and thought it was pretty good for a chain/franchise.  I was wrong...their food plain outright sucks. Bad bland appetizers: pot stickers and chicken wings. Okay so they are a pizza place maybe apps are not their thing...WRONG...the pizza was terrible as well...bad crust, too salty, bland topppings...just very Industrial tasting. the only good thing was the key lime pie...but with so many great pizza places in San Fran....I aint going back!

Came here with a friend about two weeks ago after studying at the library. It was a Thursday around 3pm. There was not that many people there. We shared a  Garlic Cheese Focaccia with Checca- Italian-style pizza bread topped with Mozzarella cheese, garlic and herbs, hearth baked and served with a combination of fresh Roma tomatoes, basil, garlic and extra-virgin olive oil. I really like it. It came with this tomato thing.  Garlic Cream Fettuccine- Fettuccine in a garlic-Parmesan cream sauce with Italian parsley. Also available with sauteed mushrooms, chicken, shrimp or chicken & shrimp. Yea we like garlic. We got the chicken. It thought it was okay. I wouldn't say that it was superb and I'll remember it forever. I threw in some of the tomatoes from the appetizer to spice it up a bit.  Overall it was a good experience although I felt like the food took a bit long to come out even though it wasn't busy at all. Also the waitress kind of pressured us to pay the check because she wanted to go home.

CPK is great in that it offers incredible variety. There's a pizza, salad or pasta dish for everyone.  We had the ranchero/mexican pizza and greek pizza with avocado. Beware, the greek pizza is essentially a greek salad on pizza bread. No cheese, no sauce. The mexican pizza tastes better cold the next morning! Service is friendly. Make sure to ask for bread and butter if you want it.

Went here with a gf. Scared of the area though. Had to park then ask the waiter to sit in front of the window so I could watch my car. Parking is easy though...not sure if that is a good thing or not.  I'm actually a huge fan. The pizzas are made to order and come out super fresh. They are quick to refill drinks and are always very nice. You definitely get worth that is worth the buck. Try the tomato and basil pizza. Yum.

Not a regular, but usually split a Field Greens salad w/Gorgonzola cheese & pizza (The Original BBQ Chicken or Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage).  Not into the salad covered pizzas.  Never tried the pasta or sandwich. Plus: Great, large salads. A cheap, fast sit down place to eat near the Symphony & Opera.  Minus: Mediocre pizzas.

Most of my CPK experiences has been me curled up on the couch, eating their chicken garlic pizza that I baked in the oven, watching an episode of Intervention. I don't know, kids, it was a lot of fun... when I could still afford luxuries like cable. I went to CPK a couple times. They seem to have this strange obsession with combining strange toppings with other salad-like ingredients. In fact, there are a few items on their menus that have straight up salads on their pizzas. Like the California Club. I had it twice and the second time I thought I would be smart and order it without the mayo drenched lettuce. I felt nothing but sorrow when I realized the pizza was too dry without the lettuce. Oh well. Maybe I need to accept this fusion of salad and pizza. Five servings of fruit and vegetables a day, right?

CHEESECAKE Pizza Kitchen - yup, you heard right, this place has AWESOME cheesecake! Over the holidays, we headed here before the Opera (as we're so cultured) & snarfed on the usual pizza & since it was the holidays, I decided to treat myself to dessert as well.  Well, let's be real, I would have treated myself even if it weren't the holidays...who am I kidding.   Was I already full from the pizza?  Yeah but come on, it was the holidays & a great excuse to indulge even more & take it to the next level! OMG what a great decision that was!  They had this Pumpkin Cheesecake that was absolutely to die for & I'm STILL thinking about it, it was that good. Thick, cookie-like graham cracker crust w/ this dense, swirly pumpkin cheesecake filling.....all covered w/ a caramel drizzle.  Sccccccrrrrrrrrrumptious!!!! Bad news is that it was a seasonal-only treat but now it's got me thinking if the Pumpkin Cheesecake was so delicious, do their other desserts rock as well?  Usually too full to do the dessert but lesson learned to save room, from now on!! CPK is somewhere we can consistently count on for their pizza.  I usually opt for the Tortilla, Mushroom, or 4-Cheese pizza & no matter where we go, it's consistently good.  Not the best pizza I've ever had in my life, mind you but hits the spot when I'm looking for a quick fru-fru pizza.   The cheesecake puts them to the 4-star ranking in my book & I'm looking forward to trying their other sweet treats!

This CPK is decorated a bit nicer than others I've been to.  When my family and I come here, we always make reservations to avoid any wait.  Service here seems to be much nicer and more attentive than other CPK's.  My family made reservations for a larger dining party than had actually showed and the staff here didn't give us attitude for it.  Instead, they were friendly and said we could keep the larger table anyways. The food? Well, if you've been to any CPK, I find the food to all be the same for the most part - tasty and filling!

Pizza was pretty good but after eating the chowder I only got around the corner of the building before I was puking my guts up.  If I haven't been drinking copious amounts of alcohol and I'm blowing chunks then god dammit Houston, we have a problem.

Nom, Nom, Nom! Love me some CPK! I love this location over the new 3rd street location too because it's a bit more of a local scene and you don't get a lot of the tourists like you do downtown. I crave almost everything on the menu every now and then, and have never had a menu item here that I didn't like! Friendly staff too. Sometimes there is a pretty big lunch rush from City Hall, so be prepared for a little bit of a wait on weekdays, but other than that perfection.

I usually like smaller places with a local flair, but CPK has been a regular stop for me since the 1980s.  I'm a fan of Little Star and Defina, but let's face it, this place has done something right over the years. I had the fusilli pasta, Sicilian pizza and a salad with avocado, roasted corn and egg plant ... ordered it on-line and picked it up curbside.  Worked out well for $39.

I am pretty much done with this place after paying 15 bucks for a personal palm sized pizza that had the rubbery texture of a microwaved frisbee. Same story as the last time I ate there and got some kind of Fiesta Eggrolls. Microwaved mush. This chain clearly has the confidence of a fat, rich, douchebag driving a Ferrari. Both are courting people way out of their league and still shacking up. Never again CPK, you have fooled me one too many times.  The only reason I threw two stars at them is the fact that the staff are incredibly nice and they have a couple desserts (like the tiramisu, which can help me get my sugar high on in a pinch)

I love the CPK Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza.  That's what I order when I find myself in a CPK.  My dining partners have ordered the jambalaya (ok) and sandwiches (not that great).  I'm minusing a star due to the horrible parking in Civic Center!  We had to practically take a bite and run out and feed the meter (25 cents for every 10 min!!?!?).  That totally sucks! Otherwise, the food is good for chain restaurants!

I ordered the Cabo Crab Cakes and Sesame Ginger Chicken Dumplings as the appetizers.  The Original BBQ Chicken Pizza and the Kung Pao Spaghetti was ordered and it was SUPERB!   The best part was our server and the Tiramisu Cake... delish!!!
they left out the fuckin crab from my food. it was a CRAB dish. so naturally, we called to say something. guess what!? THEY DIDN'T CARE TO FIX THE PROBLEM i want my fuckin money back.
Great call in service! I often times stay at the days inn on geary and walk up to cpk .  good service same prices as anywhere and a consistently good pizza every order !

Decent pizza.  (But you can get it at a grocery store now.) Pasta dishes are good and hearty portions. I'm a huge fan of their soups and salads though--very interesting flavors and creations. Great drinks, and nice well-stocked bar. Their bar has a nice TV too.  :-) Their service is always good.  Even if they are busy. If you go there for lunch, call ahead and asked to be placed on their list, as long as you get there within 30 minutes. But they run a bit high on the prices for certain items.

The guy here addressed my friends and I as 'children' . Anyways the pizza here are sooo small! What happened? I remember that it used to be soo big! I am disappointed! I would rather go to costco to get a pizza. But anyways I got the BBQ chicken pizza, it tasted like how BBQ chicken pizza would taste like and the all veggie pizza which was like tasteless! But I do like the unlimited Italian soda refills!

This location is near my work. I've enjoyed a sandwich here and the pizzas of course. My favorite is the mango chicken pizza, and I forget the actual name. I recommend CPK but it can be crowded at the noon hour so come early if you have a short lunch hour and try to get a private booth.

Took out one of my Mom on a Sat afternoon. Went back to CPK since it's close to War Memorial Theatre. I'm impressed the service was superb. If only I can get my staff to act that way, life would be pleasant. Our waiter who have a blond hair was super attentive but not annoying. Trust me my mom can be high maintenance sometimes. I happy to say that my appetite was on full swing. I ordered a Kung Pao Spaghetti and a Bloody Mary. I finished the Spaghetti but the Bloody Mary can be better. Half salad is a good size........ I would come back, I'm big on service. Yummy food and affordable price.

I'm truly disappointed by this place as I've been eating here for 5 years. First we got ignored by the host, then the manager, and when we got sat, everyone else got their drinks but us. The server R-Jay didn't know what we ordered from another server. Pathetic. Didn't get our order right, couldn't remember what we were drinking and I had to ask for salsa three times.

This was my first initiation into the California Pizza Kitchen experience. I have to admit, I was prepared for some kind of mind-blowing, amazing pizza experience, since my girlfriend kept telling me how great California Pizza Kitchen is, for her SoCal experience of it. Well, the experience was kind of a let down. The cheese had this weird flat quality that could only have come from having been pre-made, stuck in a proofer for several hours, and then maybe microwaved to warm it up. The chicken had a kind of dry, less-than-fresh quality that probably came from the pizza sitting around for hours.  Overall, you get a better value with frozen pizza from Safeway. On the plus side, the salad was pretty good. If you do end up here somehow, by all means, order a salad. You'll be getting the most bang for your buck that way.

I have been here only once.   I went here w/ my friend Steph for the first time for lunch on a very rare  day of. Apparently UC Hastings (or was it California Cullinary Academy) garduation was happening in close vecinity cuz lots of people in gowns were walking around. Why they would go to CPK, I have no clue. The seating was prompt and I ordered the soup and Steph ordered some pizza (this was a while ago and I forget the pizza specifics).  1) Fairly good service, water refils, etc. 1+ 2) Quick seating. 1+ 3) Very comfy corner booth. 1+ 4) Clean environment 1+ 5) Prompt food preperation (order to recept of food) 1+ 6) The soup was too salty for me 1- Then the shit hit the fan. My friend's lunch was winding down and I ask for the check. 5 mins goes by.......10 mins goes by.......finally I have to ask the waitress what is going on and she says that the computers are down. My friend takes off as her lunch is over. I sit for another 10 mins (trying to be as patient as possible). I ask again if the computers are up and running. I'm told that I can pay cash or wait. Not having any cash, I offer to go to an ATM  and my waitress looks at me like I'm going to ditch. Are you kidding me? "You have my card....how/why would I ditch?" I say. She stares at me blankly. Insulted that they would think that, I just say that I will wait. Finally the kitchen manager comes out and says that the meal was complimentary. I get up and leave. -1

HEY.  I wrote a review for CPK this wknd, and then my internet died :(.  So now I have to rewrite it.  Here's a summary: I was just saying that this is prob the healthiest pizza place I've been to.  It's not too oily or anything.  They do a good job being creative with the various styles, especially ones from different countries.  The Indian one is RIGHT ON.  The spices are totally indian and everything. i don't know why people are saying its expensive either.  It's reasonably priced.   The other reason I'm rating it so high is cuz their chocolate souffle is so yummy.  mmmm gooey warm chocolate oozing out of a super moist dark chocolate cake.....

I went to California PIzza Kitchen with a friend. We had pizzas (:d) and they were great. I took a Wild Mushroom pizza and my friend took a Mango Tandori Chicken pizza. Both were tasty. The service was also great. The waiter was very friendly and there only when it was necessary. I also liked the atmosphere in that restaurant that was nearly cozy.

Occasionally Yelpers look like giant whiners.  Sorry, but I think some of you are expecting to find gourmet NY-style perfection here or something.  Would we like better pizza in the city?  Sure.  But CPK is about "generally good value and quality" in a comfy environment. GREAT, but GREAT for kids.  I can eat a well prepared saled (Waldorf, Thai Crunch, Chinese Chicken), share a thin-crust pizza with the hubbie, and watch my 4 year old entertain herself looking out the window on Van Ness - buses, people, her own little cheese pizza.  Happy kid = Happy parents. People, CPK is a chain.  But as chains go, it's quite good.  And while I have at times had uneven or rushed service here, I've much more often had kind, funny, attentive, smiling and VERY kid friendly service here. SF is full of fancy dish places with sucky service.  I enjoy the consistency of CPK food, the quality of salads especially, the fairly priced wines by the glass - and the nearly always friendly treatment of this tired, urban mom with kid in tow. Also - I've found the managers VERY responsive to feedback when things weren't quite right.  At least they TRAIN servers here.  Which is much more you can say for the many trattorias and fancy joints around town with snotty, absent minded, "me first" wait staff who plotz any time you sit down with a kid under the age of 12.   To me, CPK is the best example of chains that work.  If you go and think it needs improvement - try stepping up and discussing it with management.  These folks are all about quality control - but they have to HEAR from you first, dears...  In person, not on Yelp.

Today, an acquaintance and I decided to eat at California Pizza Kitchen on Van Ness Ave, since it was near City Hall. This waitress that helped us had an attitude, and didn't even seem like she wanted to help us. On top of that, the food was mediocre, and was costly. She served these two men sitting near us with an attitude as well. I wouldn't be surprised if she's been spitting in people's food/drink all day. If you want a classy, elegant place to eat with co-workers or friends, this is not the place to go.
I agree that the pizza is crap.  I will never go back.  The crust was comparable to shoe leather.

I'm a big fan of CPK. I love the pizza--the endless options. The CPK I used to frequent was very family-friendly, and I was surprised at the ambient lighting--dare I say, romantic even?--at the Van Ness location. Service was superb. And the pizza...bomb.

Note:  I am basing my review off the only things I ever eat here.  The Waldorf salad and Ice Cream Sundae.  Both of which are excellent.  The Waldorf salad is amazing.  A huge salad you can easily share with someone.  Their Sundae did a great job at satisfied my sugar craving.    Oddly enough I've never had pizza here.  I avoid large chains for pizza.  I have better places to go for that.   The only thing I didn't like is the service.  Waitresses forget about you and don't clear plates or refill drinks.  They also take their sweet time bringing your check.

CPK, in general, is slipping.  I haven't had a decent pizza/experience from them since the mid-90s.  Yet, I keep going, hoping that their Peking Duck Pizza will have that same goodness I remembered from back in high school when eating here was hella hella good. Now this overfranchised restaurant has lost its quality in food, ingredients, and staff.  Every location has become consistent in these bad traits and I am not really tempted to go here.   Even the frozen grocery store versions aren't that great!

A guy once took me out on our first (and only) date to a CPK.   Who the hell does that and thinks that it's good idea?!   Needless to say, it didn't work out (the food nor the date). I'd rather eat at a questionable hole in the wall than a mind-numbing chain restaurant that reminds me of a taxi cab.

We returned today and were the first of three to enter the restaurant. An older waiter who has waited on us previously a few times had a trainee under his wings, and as this trainee waited on the customers, he stood off behind to the side to "assist". That is acceptable of course as everyone is a trainee at some time of their life....  but did he have to tell/suggest/scold this trainee about his wording/mannerisms/etc within inches of three tables (later) that was occupied and in such a tone that everyone could hear clearly? After this waiter did it for the fourth time - always among the tables and within earshot of the customers - I looked for the manager and just seconds before leaving, the general manager walked up. I explained the situation to him then returned to my table and I know the "waiter" had seen me as he turned his back on me intentionally, and avoided eye contact from there on. Then to make my point very clear, he again spoke to the trainee right in front of us and within earshot of four tables full of the lunch crowd. grrrrrrrrr I've seen this behavior several times since returning to the City and do not like it thence the 2 stars.
Whatever you do, don't get the BLT pizza.  Try the more genuine italian style pizzas.

Are there any redeeming qualities about this location of CPK?  The service was awful.  Our waitress got our simple pizza order wrong twice.  She didn't bring out the beer I ordered.  She was catty.   CPK isn't usually that bad, but the pizza at this location tasted like cardboard.  Sometimes I wish California didn't always need their version of stuff.  This place should be called California Cracker with shit on it kitchen.

You know what I like about CPK?  It makes me think of running around in L.A. back in the 80s... big hair, clove cigarettes, and Van Halen.  (Ah, those are some fond memories!)  Twenty years later I'm in S.F. and I get my hair cut with clippers, have quit smoking, and frequent the SF Opera (though I still like to rock out to "Hot For Teacher"!) CPK is also good for food... salads, pizza, and drinks.  I like a lot of other local pizza joints way better than this, but my parter really likes it and I have a hard time saying no to that totally awesome jaunt down memory lane.

If you go here, you gotta order the BBQ chicken pizza!  I can live off this stuff right here.   Pizzas are decently priced, staff is very courteous and speedy and of course the food is great.. Only downfall is the lack of  (virtually no) parking accomodations for customers.  I guess thats expected tho when operating a business on one of the busiest streets in San Francisco ...

I like CPK, I used to eat here all the time mostly lunch but the occasional dinner. This location has great atmosphere and comfortable seating.  Although pretty loud for lunch, especially on weekdays. On weekdays, you should try to make it there before the 12noon rush, to avoid a wait of about 15-20 minutes to be seated. Good food, my favorite are the BBQ Chicken Salad and the Margarita Pizza. Good drinks, although they could be more creative at least with the mojitos. Staff are friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. Bathroom, although odd location, are clean. - Read Devon's Numero Uno I didn't know they let the homeless eat, that's not cool.

Just another CPK but I think for SoCal people, they tend to gravitate here because it is the only one in the city (as opposed to SoCal where you find them almost as much as you find Starbucks).   The service here is pretty good during the week, they can get you in and out of here in an hour during the lunch rush - but you need to let them know you only have an hour.  Menu is huge, lots to pick from.  My current fav is the Chicken Waldorf salad.   Service on the weekends is a bit slower, it definitely isn't ever crowded on the weekends and the staff seems to assume that no one is in a rush.  I guess the moral of the story is, if you have somewhere to be, regardless of when you go, let them know and they will get you out of there on time.
Despite its chain-y look and feel, CPK offers decent food at decent prices, and they can accomodate big groups.  I love the texture of their bread, and haven't been disappointed by their pizzas.
I've eaten here for years and always though the food was fine... until my entire family got food poisoning this past December!!!  Stay away from the Chicken Lettuce Thai Wraps!!!

3 stars as I wrote this yelp based on a recent visit and not one where I would have given them -32 stars. We walked in at about 8:30pm, so the place was not even half packed. We then proceed to wait about 5 minutes until we're helped. Thought that was a tad too long for the place not even being full. However, our waitress made up for it w/ great service along w/ some good eatin. The girlfriend had the garlic pasta n I had the grilled chicken cesar sandwich. Both were good...along w/ the complimentary bread..yeah, I'm a biggy on the bread..haha
Food is great! I've always had good customer service there... only bad thing is the parking, no garage... just street parking.

The word Sucks comes to mind. This is not necessarily california pizza the chain but california pizza in general. What utter crap pizza is in this city. Can't make good pizza so lets hide it by piling on loads of crap like thai chicken pizza. Where the hell is the pizza?!?! I can't even see it. Why does the crust all taste like it was previously frozen?  What the heck, I can always stick a package of mama celeste in the microwave if I wanted frozen crapola.

cpk?  hmm...no.  few choices for vegetarians and practically nothing for vegans. that's not very california of you, california pizza kitchen. also, two of my meat eating friends have gotten food poisoning from a shared chicken pizza. shit. they're lucky they didn't get the g-d avian flu! y'all better stop eating birds now before you wind up 6 feet under!!! this avian flu is NO JOKE! birds are PISSED OFF...they are like, "how do you like dying prematurely, you stupid asshole humans?!" and i am like, "that's right, birds!  just don't put that bird flu death virus shit into the air because i ain't done nothing to you!"  ANYWAY. you have been warned re: CPK and possible death due to avian flu. and don't come crying to me from beyond the grave because ghosts scare the living shit out of me. ooh...i guess i shouldn't have told you that. just forget this whole review.

I am ashamed to say I finally tried CPK and really like it. My friend and I got season tickets for the City Arts and Lectures series at Herbst. CPK is right there, and we were usually able to get parking on the alley right next to it. The reason we liked it was for the salads, which there is a good variety, and they are huge and flavorful. I like the grilled vegetable salad and the waldorf. The dressing is good but best on the side, you just need a little. Sourdough bread was a nice accompaniment. The one time I ordered a pizza, the thai chicken, was very disappointed: it was super salty, and the crust was not cooked enough and just kind of yucky. Also, it is rather pricey. But the service was very good.

i've eaten here and ordered out many times, each time hoping their service will be better.  service is poor or mixed.  food is okay.  i like their salads.  sometimes, they forget my order or get it wrong.  i only come here because its close to my work and i'm out of alternatives.

I have been a fan of CPK for years, now...I go here often just for the Waldorf chicken salad...mmm...it's DAMN good. If you like crispy, thin pizza's get the sicilan style...italiansausages...it's really good! The rest of the menu is quite buttery, even the soups. The service and local is nothing special - but it's convenient for where I work! :)
the thai chicken pizza makes for an excellent dinner, before or after going to the movie theatre right up the street.

I love this place even though its a chain.  The Chinese Chicken salad is great...something about the dressing is good.  I still come here even though some of the waiters are rude and service is slow on a busy night and they try to rush you out.  I hate how the restrooms are somewhere in another building.

I tagged along with a couple friends for a birthday party or some sort of get together at CPK. I really don't know, I was just there for the food.  And I just have to say it was craptastic.  If a pizza place makes me long for the slices at SFSU, then it's really not worth mentioning.  The bread was burnt, the ingredient combos strange and just the whole atmosphere really did not agree with me.
I love their pizzas and salads.  The service is always great.  They also have free drink refills.

Worst service ever. They were never creme-de-la-creme, but this was embarrassing for even me. After they finally came to take my order (15+ minutes after being seated) the waiter tried to excuse the behavior by stuttering between "I didn't see you", and "I didn't know this was my table". Maybe it's because I'm Canadian (wink wink), but I was ashamed to be dinning there. As my meal progressed, I had to remind him to refill empty glasses and to bring my earlier requested water. In the end I couldn't wait for this guy to get around to bringing the check. I just gave him my credit card and made haste out the door and never to return. Of course my waiter was alittle more anxious to get me out the door and kept offering to wrap up my food (barely eaten and not of the best quality).  I was one of the three tables this guy was covering.  I left decent tip but immediately regretted it. I tried to tell myself kindness kills, but when someone from the other side of the restaurant notices you haven't been helped, it's not good news folks. Stay clear if you're Canadian.
Really like their split pea soup and their goat cheese w/roasted peppers pizza. my friend told me that they have new yummy desserts so i'll have to try those next time.

pizza's alright, the frozen stuff really tastes no different.  so is that good frozen food or kinda good pizza? the avocado club egg rolls are hella yummy.  the last time i went i had a really good server. He was just really nice and you could tell he knew what he was doing.  The manager there is good too. He helps his team, works the floor. That's a good manager.

This the CPK standard menu that you get at, well, every CPK.  Typically I'd put a chain more in the 3 star category, but I'd give CPK an extra half star for their consistent quality, and another half star to this location for being a stone's throw from my apartment. Tip: extremely accommodating if you need to get a quick meal before the symphony/opera.

I went to CPK after a really long time.. As always was really happy with the service. Desmond, was great at it and our food was great. I tried thai linguini ( hope I spelled it right) was a great combination of pasta and thai sauce.  and I love their pineapple colada.
"Delicious pizza! I'm not a bacon lover but I LOVE their BLT pizza.  Great location, good service.  Their chicken salad is also very good and the red velvet cake was yummy!
Sorry, I thought the BBQ chicken pizza was pretty tasty. I was starving at the time, so it tasted so much better. I doubt I'll be back unless I'm starving on Van Ness again.

Looks like we have lots of contention here.  It is not true pizza, (as I was raised on Round Table, Brick Oven, now long gone, and Village Host Pizza in Burlingame), but I go for the roasted garlic chicken pizza, and I am happy.  I like the corn soup, and the asian dumplings.  Does feel chain like, but the prices are pretty good.  There a few recent additions, like my all time favorite kind, margherita --- simple with just basil and tomato.  Another new thin crust pie has lots of salami type meat on it ... not too bad either.

This is the 3rd time I have ever been to a CPK.  It was pretty good. I had the MISO Salad. Very good. I paid an extra $4 to get shrimp and crab on it.  Not bad. I ordered the half portion and it was still huge.  The bread was a bit hard and the butter was served in one of those plastic containers with the peel off top.  It's usually busy during the week for lunch so I went in at about two.  If you can have a late lunch, avoid the craziness.  Parking kind of sucks.  Try to avoid parking at the meters. What a rip off.  And the meter maids are ticket happy in the alley.  Watch out.

Me & some of my classmates decided to go to cpk after class tonight. Service was great!!  We were definately pampered=0) I like be pampered. Anyways I ordered the (hhhmmmm I am thinking) anyways I don't remember right now, but It was good. It had sausage, olives, green bell pepper, and onions. The crust was thin and perfect. I ordered this huge slice of pecan cheesecake to go and I am about to go "handle it" now. Our waiter kwame was very attentive during our whole dinner. He made sure our orders was correct and we were never thirsty while we were there. He also checked in a couple times to see how we were doing, which is always a plus. Would definately return=0)

A plus because of all the really funky stuff you can get (the 4-mushroom pizza is quite good), but it is a bit overpriced for pizza. And being a chain in a city with so many other, vastly superior pizza joints... I just can't recommend it.

Good for big groups, I think the pizza is good, I especially like the thai chicken or bbq chicken or jerk chicken pizza.  It's also a big ugly chain and I wouldn't go there unless it was for an event.

A couple of years ago, I would have given it four stars because it's consistent (yeah chain food!) and the pastas and salads are pretty good.  Not such a fan of the pizza crust, but the pizza is still decent.  But it seems like it's getting pricier every time I stop by... I don't really want to pay $15 for pasta or a full sized salad.  Still, it's a decent choice, and it fits my cravings -- which tend to be very specific.

This particular location isn't all that wonderful, but they do have some great dishes.  I enjoy very much the spinach artichoke dip appetizer with either the chips they provide or the bread.  The dumplings aren't bad either.  Always a fan of the BBQ chicken pizza and BBQ chicken chop salad.  Actually, I love the pizza combinations that they have here, it's just that they don't make them very well.  It seems as though they are a little sloppy with their final product.  Anyway, still love the soups, salads, and pizzas.  Side note: the CPK frozen pizzas are not that good.  Better off getting the real thing.

This CPK is the worst that I have been to.  Their entrees are just not up to par.  The waitress forgot my food and my friend's drink, and when she finally brought my food around, I took a few bites, got a little funny feeling in my stomach, and ran to the bathroom to throw it up very quickly.  Not sure what is going on here.  Normally CPK is my dependable comfort food.  Maybe I'll give this place another try.

I hadn't been to a CPK in many years, so I was interested to try it again the other day during a lunchtime recess of jury duty. (The courthouse is right around the corner, very convenient!) It was yummy yummy yummy! I had a hard time picking from all the pizzas, so I just went with the BBQ chicken, which the menu says is the most popular. Sure enough, it turned out to be delicious, and just the right size. I left feeling satisfied but not overly stuffed. I also love that if you order lemonade or a fountain drink, you get unlimited refills. I ordered the strawberry lemonade, and it was so good I must have had my glass refilled at least 5 times. And finally, for dessert (yeah, yeah, I know) I picked the red velvet cream cheese cake rather than the chocolate souffle on the recommendation of my server. Gut-wrenchingly delicious. One curious thing I noticed though: An awful lot of people were ordering the salad. May I just ask why on earth you'd order something like that in a pizza restaurant? Even if they're really good...why??? You go to a pizza place, get the pizza! Don't be so obsessed about the carbs! Burn them off later! You think that salad is low calorie? It is NOT! :) Anyway, I'm definitely coming back again!

I don't like most chain restaurants but I make an exception for CPK.  I'm addicted to the Roasted Garlic Chicken pizza.  I visited this location last week to get my fix and was pleased with the service - this is one of their better locations, even if they are mostly the same.
Pear and Gorgonzola is to die for... great service, good prices. Consistently delicious.

I've been twice to this establishment.  The salads are wonderful and the pizzas are okay but nothing to write home about.  If you're looking for fast take out, this is your place.  The bf and I had walked in, scanned the menu, places our order and were out of there in 15 minutes.  Got to love that!

I am never disappointed when I go to CPK. It's always a pleasurable experience. Maybe not OFF-THE-CHAIN but it's a chain pizza joint, let's not be ridiculous. So I get the Chinese Chicken Salad (my favorite salad in the whole world and I do believe CPK reigns #1 on my list) to start, and then I get the Tomato, Basil & Garlic pizza. It's super plain but excellent. I just had to say something about this wonderful place. And so I did.

inexpensive is the best that I can say about this place.  Lot's of buzz and if you like your buzz to have the sound of children playing and crying then "this is the place for you".  The food is typical 'chain like' and I hope I never eat in this place again.
